html: My first Angular2 Component that prints something into screen.

This example includes the next objetives:
- Use of event binding.
- Use of form and ngModel (directive two-way binding).
- Uses of css styles and html templates.
- List of Heroes.
- Use of typescript sentences like nFor.
- Detail of a Hero.
- Edition of Heroes with id and name.
- Service implementation than obtains the list and the detail of heroes from a mock data source.
- Navigation with Router parametrized class.

You can do the example in the next tutorial.

titol: My first Application Example with Angular-Cli
html:
This example is the same as the 2. My first Application Example (17/10/2016).
What it's different is than, in this one, I use Angular-Cli for generate the project, the components and for build.
Angular-Cli is in the 17th beta version for the moment, but it feels interesting.

With Angular-Cli you can:
- Generate your project with a Cli Project Structure.
- Generate the elements of your web (Components, Modules, Services, Classes, etc.).
- Build the project and Angular-Cli generate only the files necessary identifying the developing mode (dev, prod, etc.). This build compact the project and you don't need the node_modules carpet with the dependencies.

You can do the example in the next tutorial and with the angular-cli instructions.

titol: My first Application Example with Angular-cli and CRUD
html:
This example is the same as the 3. My first Application Example with Angular-cli (18/10/2016).
Here is implemented the edition, deleting and searching of a heroe.

You can:
- Edit a hero in the detail of a hero.
- Delete a hero in the list of heroes.
- Search a hero in the dashboard.

You can do the example in the next tutorial.

I develop my Web with Angular2 and Typescript, using Angular-Cli.

This project is always changing and I regularly update with the other projects.

In my web you can take a look to the projects I have done and the actual and future projects.

The projects are done with Angular 2 or with Unity.

With and eye on my objectives: a Web Editor and a Remake of Ghost'n Goblins.

Try it and have fun!

titol: Bind json array to html table
html:
This example is developed with Angular-Cli.

Is a simple example that load a JSON file into an html table with an Angular-Cli Service.

Here in davidlearns.blogspot.com you can see the explanation of the example and you can learn to do it.

This project is developed with Angular-Cli.

Are some animation components that everyone could use in his html components.

You have to extends the effect you want for your component and implements the html template and css file.

For example:
export class MyComponent extends BounceAnimationComponent { }

The animations are bounce, fade, flip, roll, rotate, zoom and others.

The source code have inspired my project is http://daneden.github.io/animate.css/.

Try it and have fun!

This project is developed with Angular-Cli.

There is a tree component loaded from a json file data with a structure of ancestors and children.

This tree is generated recursively with a app-tree-node component that calls itself.

And when the app-tree-node is loaded, ancestors are loaded recursively and the next children as well.

You can load the json file you want and the tree will show the file you choose.

The project is inspired in a tree component I did in java with xsl reading xml files five years ago.

And I thought: Could I try to do this in Angular2?

Try it and have fun!

This project is developed with Angular-Cli.

There are some divs components loaded from a json file data with title, content and styles.

These divs are draggable and droppable and you can use them with the app-div-node component.

This component is generated in the app-layout component with callback functions that make the events between divs.

Try it and have fun!

This project show the weather prediction in Spain the next four days. Use a configurable widget provided by AEMET.
You can find any municipality in Spain.

I'm going to improve enhancements shortly!

The camera follows the character in a terrain.

Unity do all the work!
There are three moons with lights and new objects like trees and houses all with textures and shadows.
In this example you can move the camera dragging the mouse and with the key row up you can throw the ball that collisions with the cube and the action changes the material of the two objects.

In this example, you can see the player and you can move him only in the platform.
The camera follows the player (the follows could be do better).
The player can walk, run and jump. It want to emulate a Platforms Games (at least initially).

This example shows three cubes.

One with a texture, another with another texture and the middle one with a Shader Texture with 50% of a the first texture and 50% of the second texture.

This example shows the screen divided for the middle.

On the left side, there's a perspective camera that follows the player always behind him.

On the right side, there's a multipurpose perspective camera that follows the player recovering the position behind him.

This example shows a dragon that was generated in Blender 3D modeling computer program gets from tf3dm.com.

This Dragon have animations created in Blender and I use one of this on a key event.

There's load a default animation that loads on the beginning.

If you press the key up arrow the dragon walk.

This example shows a terrain with textures and with water.

This is my first example with water, so it's very easy.

This is a comparative between AngularJS and Angular2 with the Google application Trends.

路 Conclusions at October of 2016

- Angular2 began one year ago, but it's relevance doesn't arrive at 25% of AngularJS's relevance.
- Angular2 and AngularJS are mostly use in India.
- Angular2 only arrive in India, Canada, USA, Japan and Europe. The rest of the World doesn't know it.

titol: Comparative between Unity and the other Game Engine
html:
This is a comparative between Unity and the other Game Engine with the Google application Trends.

路 Conclusions at October of 2016

- Unity is mostly use Game Engine.
- PlayStation4 and Xbox 360 are more relevant than Unity.
- Nvidia is equatable with Unity.
- In China, people are more interested in produce Games than in play them.
- PlayStation4 is the most used in USA, Canada, Australia and Europe.
- XBox 360 is most used in South America and Mexico.
- Nvidia is most used in Rusia

titol: Comparative between Sketchup and the other 3D modeling computer program
html:
This is a comparative between Sketchup and the other 3D modeling computer program with the Google application Trends.

路 Conclusions at October of 2016

- Skechtup and Blender are the most relevant 3D modeling computer program in the last year.
- Sketchup is mostly used in South Ameria and Australia and Blender in USA and Europe.
- 3d Studio Max and Maya are mostly used in Asia and India.
- Studying the evolution, we can see that 3d Studio Max and Maya were more important in the USA and in Europe ten years ago.
- In the last five years, Sketchup and Blender got more relevance, because these last ones are free.
- Considering that the USA and Europe are the future, Sketchtup and Blender are the 3D modeling computer program of the future as well.
- Like we saw in the comparative between Game Engines, XBox is mostly used were is mostly used Sketchup. And PlayStation4 is mostly used were is mostly used Blender.

titol: Comparative between VR (Virtual Reality) and PlayStation4 and XBox 360 GameConsoles
html:
This is a comparative between VR (Virtual Reality) and PlayStation4 and XBox 360 GameConsoles with the Google application Trends.

路 Conclusions at December of 2016

- VR is growing in all the World in the last year.
- PlayStation4 and Xbox 360 are more relevant than VR.
- The growing of PlayStation4 and XBox 360 is influenced by VR.
- VR is more relevant in Europe, North America, Canada and Australia.

Objectives:

- This project aims to investigate and find out which subjects are of interest to the world.
- As the interests of the world are very wide, center the searches in regions with similar interests (I begin with Spain).
- And as interests vary over time, I will focus on the present.
- The Searches use the Google Trends Engine.
